title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1631-2.1 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1631-2.1 - General

State Regulations
(a) Accidents are
costly in terms of money, material and manpower. Their elimination or reduction
should be a paramount objective for every authority. (b) Safety (accident prevention) is largely a
matter of eliminating hazardous conditions, anticipating the creation of
dangerous situations, and fostering and promoting an awareness of conditions
conducive to the creation of accidents. (c) Accident prevention is the responsibility
of administrative and supervisory employees. It is they who must wage a
continuing campaign for safety in all project activities. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1631-2.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
